page.title: 07THE IREBY CHALICE
page.content: The Ireby Chalice is one of the most precious of Ireby's treasures. After nearly being lost to the parish forever, through good fortune the Parish regained possession of the Chalice in 1980. The Chalice is a rare Elizabethan silver cup and was made by Edward Dalton of Wigton around 1571. The Chalice belonged to Ireby Church until 1848, when the Bishop and Churchwardens presented it to Mrs. Grainger of High Ireby in gratitude for her gift of a new set of silver for the Church to commemorate her son's christening. The Chalice was in the possession of various people but was finally purchased from an antique dealer for Â£4000, and re-dedicated at its home-coming on Palm Sunday 1980.
